1.name: Chet Haase
1.title: Developer Advocate
1.shortBio: Chet Haase is the lead of the Android UI Toolkit team at Google, where he works on graphics, animation, widgets, and...
1.bio: Chet Haase is the lead of the Android UI Toolkit team at Google, where he works on graphics, animation, widgets, and anything else that puts pixels on the screen. He's been known to write and perform comedy and also to speak at developer conferences like this one.

2.name: Romain Guy
2.title: Developer Advocate
2.shortBio: Romain Guy works on Android graphics and UI technologies at Google.
2.bio: Romain Guy works on Android graphics and UI technologies at Google.

3.name: Sandeep Dinesh
3.title: Cloud Developer Advocate,
3.shortBio: Sandeep started coding and creating websites when he was 12 and hasn't stopped. He is passionate...
3.bio: Sandeep started coding and creating websites when he was 12 and hasn't stopped. He is passionate about building easy-to-use products people love. Before Google, he founded an IoT startup in agriculture and developed educational HTML5 games. At Google, Sandeep's goal is to make cloud easy and help developers create the next big thing. Sandeep loves video games, making music, and martial arts, and has Bachelors in Marketing and Computer Science.

4.name: Terry Ryan
4.title: Developer Advocate
4.shortBio: Terry Ryan is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform team. He has 15 years...
4.bio: Terry Ryan is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform team. He has 15 years of experience working with the web - both front end and back. Before working for technology shops like Google and Adobe he worked in roles that combined development with system administration at the Wharton School of Business.

5.name: Justin Ribeiro
5.title: Google Developer Expert
5.shortBio: I build and hack on just about anything, Stickman Ventures, Inc. Co-organizer of the GDG Oakdale, a GDE, Oakdale OpenMesh, and...
5.bio: I build and hack on just about anything, Stickman Ventures, Inc. Co-organizer of the GDG Oakdale, a GDE, Oakdale OpenMesh, and his three daughters. 18+ years development experience and author of the upcoming book Developing a Google Glass Edge, he is constantly building software, sensors, and hacking on toys.

6.name: Lauren Long
6.title: Firebase Engineer
6.shortBio: Full-stack web developer and startup geek
6.bio: Lauren Long is a full-stack web developer and startup geek. She is currently an engineer on the Firebase team at Google San Francisco. Lauren co-founded Boxit, a storage-on-demand company that operates in Toronto, Canada. She also was the first Product Manager at Nymi - the maker of the world’s first wristband that knows who you are based on your heartbeat. She enjoys writing and speaking about web development and the ups and downs of running a startup. She loves to travel, and her adventures have taken her to Germany for medical imaging research and to the Arctic to lead children's literacy camps.

7.name: Martin Omander
7.title: Developer Relations Program Manager
7.bio: Martin Omander works for Google in Mountain View, California. His job in the Developer Relations team is to support awesome developer communities, like the Google Developer Groups. On his spare time he manages to sneak in some programming, usually writing HTML5 apps running on top of Firebase. Before Google, Martin worked at string of startups in Silicon Valley as a software engineer.

8.name: Elizabeth Padilla
8.title: Program Manager for Privacy and Security
8.shortBio: Program Manager for Privacy and Security
8.bio: Is a Program Manager for Privacy and Security. Her job is to gain and maintain user trust. She is also a skilled public speaker who has trained world experts and Googlers.

9.name: Vikram Tiwari
9.title: Full Stack Developer
9.shortBio: Vikram Tiwari is full stack developer focused on building scalable web platforms for high availability...
9.bio: Vikram Tiwari is full stack developer focused on building scalable web platforms for high availability, resilience and security. He is currently building solutions to simplify multi-channel advertising space at Omni Labs, Inc. in San Francisco, California. In past he has built a Real-Time Bidder which served over ~12Bn queries each day. Outside of work, he has a passion for contributing to open source community as one of the core contributors in MEAN Stack framework, among other web and cloud projects. He loves working with startups and developers in helping them navigate through challenges and succeed in their journey.

10.name: Chris Conley
10.title: Director of Engineering
10.shortBio: Chris currently heads up the RealScout engineering team with a focus on continuous learning and action...
10.bio: Chris currently heads up the RealScout engineering team with a focus on continuous learning and action, cultivating thought diversity and making a difference in the real estate industry and our software engineering community. Prior to RealScout, he co-founded one of the first civic apps in the country, iSepta.org, was co-founder and CTO of an accelerator-backed startup, and led development at Monetate as an engineering director.

11.name: Claire Bendersky
11.shortBio: Claire Bendersky is a software engineer and educator in the San Francisco Bay Area.
11.bio: Claire Bendersky is a software engineer and educator in the San Francisco Bay Area. She strives to strengthen and elevate her community through access to data and knowledge of how to access data.

12.name: Hod Greeley
12.title: Developer Advocate
12.shortBio: Hod is a Developer Advocate for Couchbase, living in Silicon Valley...
12.bio: Hod is a Developer Advocate for Couchbase, living in Silicon Valley. He has over two decades of experience as a software engineer and engineering manager. He has worked in a variety of software fields, including computational physics and chemistry, computer and network security, finance, and mobile. Prior to joining Couchbase in 2016, Hod led developer relations for mobile at Samsung. Hod holds a Ph.D. in Chemical Physics from Columbia University.

13.name: Juniper Belmont
13.title: Developer Advocate
13.shortBio: June is a genderqueer developer advocate passionate about the open web platform. They love meeting people, talking about...
13.bio: June is a genderqueer developer advocate passionate about the open web platform. They love meeting people, talking about their passions, and giving presentations interspersed with bawdy jokes and lavish, mostly true stories. They use they/them pronouns and they can be found @juniperbelmont

14.name: Murat Yener
14.title: Android Geek
14.shortBio: Murat Yener is a code geek, open source committer, Java Champion and Google Developer Expert on Android, who is working...
14.bio: Murat Yener is a code geek, open source committer, Java Champion and Google Developer Expert on Android, who is working at Intel as an Android developer. He is the author of Expert Android Studio and Professional Java EE Design Patterns books from Wiley. He has extensive experience with developing Android, Java, web, JavaEE, and OSGi applications, in addition to teaching courses and mentoring. Murat is an  Eclipse committer and one of the initial committers of the Eclipse Libra project. Murat has been a user group leader at GDG Istanbul since 2009, organizing, participating, and speaking at events. He is also a regular speaker at major conferences such as DroidCon, JavaOne and Devoxx.

15.name: James Cha
15.shortBio: Developer Advocate at Clover, Co-Host of DevelopHerDevelopHim

16.name: Jessica Parsons
16.title: Web Development Instructor
16.shortBio: Former schoolteacher, professionally coding for the web since 2006.  I love making things and empowering others to make things they didn't think they could.
16.bio: Former schoolteacher, professionally coding for the web since 2006.  I love making things and empowering others to make things they didn't think they could.

17.name: Jessica Earley
17.title: Director of Part-Time Education
17.shortBio: Director of Part-Time Education at Hackbright, Co-Host of DevelopHerDevelopHim

18.name: Henry Chen
18.shortBio: Henry recieved his Physics PhD from Harvard and worked in theoretical physics and ...
18.bio: Henry recieved his Physics PhD from Harvard and worked in theoretical physics and the nonprofit world. He joined and co-founded a startup, where he learned to program. He has worked as a data scientist and software engineer for several years. Outside of work, Henry is an experienced dog trainer and enjoys graphic novels, donuts, and 90's hip hop.

19.name: Meggie Mahnken
19.shortBio: Formerly an internal tools software engineer, Meggie is ...
19.bio: Formerly an internal tools software engineer, Meggie is now, happily, a classroom-dweller at Hackbright. Years ago, she soul-searchingly parted with studies in social cognition and feminist theory to become a software engineer. While not computering, Meggie enjoys modern dance, delis, and public speaking.

20.name: Joel Burton
20.shortBio: Joel Burton is the VP of Fellowship Education for Hackbright Academy. His previous technology ...
20.bio: Joel Burton is the VP of Fellowship Education for Hackbright Academy. His previous technology work includes positions with Apple, Planned Parenthood, and as an independent consultant, trainer, and author on web application development. He is a major contributor to several open source projects, including Python, Plone, and PostgreSQL.

21.name: Arthur Thompson
21.shortBio: Arthur taught math and computer science for 7 years before coming to Google.
21.bio: Arthur taught math and computer science for 7 years before coming to Google. I then worked on various Google developer relation projects, including GMail API and Google Drive Android API. I now work on Firebase where I hope to help developers build better apps.

22.name: Dan Schlosser
22.shortBio: Dan Schlosser is an Associate Product Manager
22.bio: Dan Schlosser is an Associate Product Manager working on improving the Firebase developer experience in the Firebase Console and in Android Studio. Previously at Google, Dan worked on Polymer, a JavaScript library that helps web developers take advantage of the future of the web platform. In his free time, Dan is a web developer and CSS nerd. Dan recently graduated Columbia University with a degree in Computer Science.
